channel.title: Comments on: EI Propel Programme for Border Startups

item.title: By: Conor O'Neill
item.dc:creator: Conor O'Neill
item.description: It looks like the web-site has finally gone live Anna (a week before the deadline!) and they have all the info there.
item.content:encoded: It looks like the web-site has finally gone live Anna (a week before the deadline!) and they have all the info there.

item.title: By: Anna Vahey
item.dc:creator: Anna Vahey
item.description: Hi I have very recently set up a leather assessories label In Sligo. It is very much in its early stages. I am very interested in this program, does anyone know how and when you should apply to be on it ? Thanks Anna 087-6853095
item.content:encoded:
Hi
I have very recently set up a leather assessories label In Sligo. It is very much in its early stages. I am very interested in this program, does anyone know how and when you should apply to be on it ?
Thanks
Anna 087-6853095

item.title: By: Alan O'Rourke
item.dc:creator: Alan O'Rourke
item.description:
I will check tomorrow. For those thinking of applying. If it is CORD then they are only giving it out to about 40% of applications at the moment. Just because you get on the programme does not mean you will get financial support.
But that doesn't mean that the other supports are not worth it. I found the expertise on offer in Hothouse to be invaluable.
item.content:encoded:
I will check tomorrow. For those thinking of applying. If it is CORD then they are only giving it out to about 40% of applications at the moment. Just because you get on the programme does not mean you will get financial support.

But that doesn’t mean that the other supports are not worth it. I found the expertise on offer in Hothouse to be invaluable.

item.title: By: Conor O'Neill
item.dc:creator: Conor O'Neill
item.description: It looks like it based on the numbers but I don't know for sure.
item.content:encoded: It looks like it based on the numbers but I don’t know for sure.

item.title: By: Alan O'Rourke
item.dc:creator: Alan O'Rourke
item.description: Anyone know if the Financial support is just a CORD grant?
item.content:encoded: Anyone know if the Financial support is just a CORD grant?

item.title: By: Conor O'Neill
item.dc:creator: Conor O'Neill
item.description: Half an hour spent creating a few static pages on yola.com would be enough. Perhaps instead they have engaged some high end consultants to create the ultimate web-site?
item.content:encoded: Half an hour spent creating a few static pages on yola.com would be enough. Perhaps instead they have engaged some high end consultants to create the ultimate web-site?

item.title: By: Des Donnelly
item.dc:creator: Des Donnelly
item.description: Lets hope they will actually be able to get http://www.propelprogramme.ie/ up and running before the 24th April cut-off so we can read the more detail promised by the various EI promo. Paddy and Pat it looks so far...
item.content:encoded: Lets hope they will actually be able to get http://www.propelprogramme.ie/ up and running before the 24th April cut-off so we can read the more detail promised by the various EI promo. Paddy and Pat it looks so far…

item.title: By: Conor O'Neill
item.dc:creator: Conor O'Neill
item.description: Sinead, we're only passing on the message here. You should contact the Propel people directly if you want to progress this. Best of luck!
item.content:encoded: Sinead, we’re only passing on the message here. You should contact the Propel people directly if you want to progress this. Best of luck!

item.title: By: sinead clarke - EssenC Designs(pronounced "SandC")
item.dc:creator: sinead clarke - EssenC Designs(pronounced "SandC")
item.description: i heard about your programme earlie today and it sounds very exciting. i am from cavan and am working at my own start up business in cavan for the past year. i design and manufacture knitwear clothing and accessories for retail in ireland and abroad. in my first month of trading i exported to wales, scotland, northern ireland and japan (rep of ireland also). i am registered with the crafts council of ireland and also with the cavan enterprise board. i would love to hear more about the application process. my contact number is 087 6175117. looking forward to hearing from you. with kindest regards sinead clarke.
item.content:encoded:
i heard about your programme earlie today and it sounds very exciting. i am from cavan and am working at my own start up business in cavan for the past year. i design and manufacture knitwear clothing and accessories for retail in ireland and abroad. in my first month of trading i exported to wales, scotland, northern ireland and japan (rep of ireland also). i am registered with the crafts council of ireland and also with the cavan enterprise board. i would love to hear more about the application process. my contact number is 087 6175117.
looking forward to hearing from you.
with kindest regards
sinead clarke.
